Uses of Package
gameplay

  • Packages that use gameplay 
    Package Description
    Astar  
    gameplay  
    menu  
  • Classes in gameplay used by Astar 
    Class and Description
    Tile
    Enum class which defines the Tile type which determines which object is in each tile of the map.
  • Classes in gameplay used by gameplay 
    Class and Description
    Bomb
    Bomb class deals with explosions and Player scoring, and contains all attributes required for a bomb object.
    Bomberman 
    Brick
    This class initializes the brick game objects' positions.
    Concrete
    This class initializes the concrete walls' positions on the grid map.
    Enemy
    The Enemy class stores all the required functions done by all enemy types.
    ExitWay
    The ExitWay class stores pseudo-randomly places an exitway on the grid and loads it's image.
    Game
    The Game class is contains the main game loop which does all the drawing, as well as some gameplay logic.
    Grid
    The Grid is a simple class used to imitate a map.
    Level
    The Level class contains all the pertinent in formation about the levels.
    Player
    The Player class takes all user input and deals will all the logic related to the basic functions of bomberman, including movement, collisions, death, powerups, bombs, and pausing.
    PowerUps
    The PowerUps class deals with the powerup logic depending on the current level.
    State
    This enum defines type State which determines the current state of the game.
    Tile
    Enum class which defines the Tile type which determines which object is in each tile of the map.

    GameState
    The GameState is a simple class used to keep track of the state of the game.

    The Grid is a simple class used to imitate a map.

    The Level class contains all the pertinent in formation about the levels.
